item.title: Zohair add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "VOTE, n. The instrument and symbol of a freeman's power to make a fool of himself and a wreck of his country." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Zohair add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport; when a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Muhammad Ali Jinnah
item.description: "Think 100 times before you take a decision, But once that decision is taken, stand by it as one man." -- Muhammad Ali Jinnah

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "All that spirits desire, spirits attain." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Safeguarding the rights of others is the most noble and beautiful end of a human being." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need. " -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "I love you when you bow in your mosque, kneel in your temple, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion, and it is the spirit. " -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "The most pitiful among men is he who turns his dreams into silver and gold." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest." -- Confucious

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Let no man pull you so low as to hate him." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Zohair add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Zohair add a quote by James Blunt
item.description:
"Tracer lighting up the sky. It's another families' turn to die. A child afraid to even cry out says, He has been here.
And I see no bravery, No bravery in your eyes anymore. Only sadness." -- James Blunt

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Zohair add a quote by William Lyon Mackenzie King
item.description:
"Once a nation parts with the control of its currency and credit, it matters not who makes the nations laws. Usury, once in control, will wreck any nation. Until the control of the issue of currency and credit is restored to government and recognised as its most sacred responsibility, all talk of the sovereignty of parliament and of democracy is idle and futile.
" -- William Lyon Mackenzie King

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Jeff Lindsay
item.description: "Mutilated corpses with a chance of afternoon showers. I got dressed and went to work. " -- Jeff Lindsay

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Ernesto Che Guevara
item.description: "If you tremble with indignation at every injustice then you are a comrade of mine." -- Ernesto Che Guevara

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Ernesto "Che" Guevara
item.description: "At the risk of seeming ridiculous, let me say that the true revolutionary is guided by a great feeling of love. It is impossible to think of a genuine revolutionary lacking this quality." -- Ernesto "Che" Guevara

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Ernesto Che Guevara
item.description: "I knew that when the great guiding spirit cleaves humanity into two antagonistic halves, I will be with the people." -- Ernesto Che Guevara

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: "Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars." -- Norman Vincent Peale

item.title: Zohair add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "My message to the international community is that our silence and complicity especially on the situation in Gaza shames us all. It is almost like the behaviour of the military junta in Burma" -- Desmond Tutu
